intro: Pinalia formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan pinalia, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountain forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a distinct venation pattern. Pinalia formosana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
